title: How to Make Wire Photo Holders

methods.name: Make Wire Scrolls for the Wire Photo Holder

steps.headline: Cut the chicken wire to the desired length.
steps.description: Allow an extra 10 to 12 inches (254 mm to 304 mm) for twisting the wire to make circular scrolls and to wrap the wire holders around the base.

steps.headline: Take 1 end of the wire at the tip and bend it inward.
steps.description: Hold it tight, so that the wire curls. Continue bending it inward until you form a circle.

steps.headline: Pull the wire inward with the fingers.
steps.description: Continue doing this until you notice a circular pattern forming. Once you form 5 to 6 circles, discontinue making the circles and instead gently bend the remaining wire inward and allow the remaining wire to hang down.

steps.headline: Grab another piece of wire and continue making the circles until you make 4 or 5 of picture holder scrolls.
steps.description: Once you complete this, you can begin working on the base of the wire photo holder.

methods.name: Create the Base of the Wire Photo Holder

steps.headline: Use a rock or figurine that has a hole in the middle that extends all the way to the bottom of the figurine.
steps.description: To add even more detail to the rock, you can use acrylic paint to paint a colorful theme on the rock, which matches the photos displayed above the rock or figurine.

steps.headline: Paint the rock with acrylic paint.
steps.description: Paint the rock according to the theme of the pictures being displayed. When you have a beach-like theme, you can paint a small landscape of the beach on the rock. When you have a camping theme, you can paint a small campground with trees and mountains on the rock.

steps.headline: Apply embellishments to the rocks when you don't have paint on hand or when you want to add detail that is difficult to paint.
steps.description: You can use scrap booking embellishments or card making embellishments to add elaborate detail to the photo holder.

steps.headline: Wait for the paint on the rock to dry.
steps.description: Once the base is dry, you can begin attaching your wires to the base.

methods.name: Attaching the Wire to the Base

steps.headline: Place the bottom of the wire (the end without scrolls) underneath the rock.
steps.description: Begin twisting the wire around the rock. After you complete 1 wrap around the circle, continue wrapping the wire until you reach the length where you want the scroll to be.

steps.headline: Twist the remaining wire on the rock into additional scrolls once you have completed a minimum of 3 rotations around the rock.
Cut the remaining wire with the wire cutters.
steps.description: Adjust the wire on the holder so that it extends upward.

steps.headline: Place photos in between the circular scrolls you created with the wire.
steps.description: Keep in mind the more circles the picture passes through, the stronger the hold will be.

steps.headline: Adjust the picture on the wire.
steps.description: To give the wire picture holder a fan like appearance, spread the wires on the picture holder outward.

steps.headline: Experiment with the look of the wires by adjusting the wires different ways.
steps.description: To give the wire picture holder a special effect, push some of the wires forward and some backward.

To give the wire picture holder a special effect, push some of the wires forward and some backward.
